q: 1. Pasar uang merupakan pertemuan antara permintaan dan penawaran kredit
ch:
a.Jangka pendek
b.Jangka menengah
c.Jangka Panjang
d. jangka sedang
e.jangka tidak pasti
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the concept of 'Pasar Uang' (money market) refers to the meeting of demand and supply of credit in various tenors, not limited to:

a. Short-term
b. Medium-term
c. Long-term

So, the answer to your question is:
a. Jangka pendek
b. Jangka menengah
c. Jangka panjang

These terms are not defined explicitly in the context, but based on general financial knowledge, I can provide you with these meanings:

a. Jangka pendek (Short-term): up to 1 year
b. Jangka menengah (Medium-term): between 1 to 5 years
c. Jangka panjang (Long-term): more than 5 years

The context provided is from various regulations, including Pasal 41 (1), Pasal 28 (2), Pasal 31, Pasal 32 (1), and other articles from an unspecified regulation in the financial sector.

q: 2. Selain Bursa Efek Jakarta, Indonesia pernah mempunyai bursa efek di
ch:
a.Medan
b.Semarang
c.Surabaya 
d.Bandung
e. Makassar
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, I can see that there have been stock exchanges in several cities in Indonesia in the past, besides the current Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) in Jakarta. The context mentions Surabaya, which indicates that there was a stock exchange in Surabaya. Therefore, the answer to the question is:

c. Surabaya

(Referring to Peraturan Menteri Keuangan Republik Indonesia Nomor 31/PMK.01/2002 Tentang Pasar Modal)

q: 3. Di Bursa Efek diberlakukan system perdagangan otomatis yang dikenal dengan nama:
ch:
a.The Jakarta Automated Trading System
b.capital market
c.Automated Teller Machine
d.capital gain
e.Invesment Company
answer_mcq:
The Jakarta Automated Trading System

The system is referred to as the Jakarta Automated Trading System (JATS). This system is implemented at the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) to automate the trading process, making it faster and more efficient. The use of JATS is in line with the purpose of the IDX, which is to provide a system and/or facilities for the trading of securities. This is based on the provisions in the context from Ayat (2) of the Indonesia Stock Exchange Bylaws.

Ayat (2) Bursa Efek didirikan untuk menyelenggarakan dan menyediakan sistem dan/atau sarana perdagangan Efek. Dengan tersedianya sistem dan/atau sarana yang baik, para Anggota Bursa Efek yang sekaligus pemegang saham Bursa Efek yang bersangkutan dapat melakukan penawaran jual dan beli Efek secara teratur, wajar, dan efisien. Di samping itu, tersedianya sistem dan/atau sarana dimaksud memungkinkan Bursa Efek melakukan pengawasan terhadap anggotanya dengan lebih efektif.

q: 4. Surat tanda penyertaan atau kepemilikan seseorang dan atau badan usaha dalam suatu perusahaan dIsebut
ch:
a.Saham 
b.Obligasi 
c.Right 
d.Warrant
e.reksa dana
answer_mcq:
The context provided discusses various regulations related to capital market regulations in Indonesia, particularly on the disclosure requirements for Perseroan Terbuka (PT or open joint-stock companies). However, the context does not specifically mention the term "Surat tanda penyertaan atau kepemilikan seseorang dan atau badan usaha dalam suatu perusahaan."

To answer the question, I will provide information regarding the types of securities in a company, as discussed in the Indonesian Capital Market Law No. 8 of 1995, Article 1 number 12:

a. Saham (Shares) - a security that represents ownership in a company and grants voting rights and the right to receive dividends.

b. Obligasi (Bonds) - a security that represents a loan made by an investor to a company, with the company agreeing to repay the principal along with interest.

c. Right - a security that grants the holder the right to buy a specified number of shares at a specified price within a certain time frame.

d. Warrant - a security that grants the holder the right to buy a specified number of shares at a specified price, but with a longer time frame than a right.

e. Reksadana (Mutual Funds) - a security that pools money from investors and invests it in a diversified portfolio of securities, managed by a professional fund manager.

Based on the provided context, the term "Surat tanda penyertaan atau kepemilikan seseorang dan atau badan usaha dalam suatu perusahaan" is closest to the definition of "Saham" (Shares).

q: 9. Berikut ini yang bukan pelaku di pasar modal .
ch:
a.Emiten 
b.Perusahaan efek 
c.Reksadana 
d.BUMN
e.perusahaan publik
answer_mcq:
Pasal 1 dari Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan tentang Transaksi Efek yang Tidak Dilarang bagi Orang Dalam menyebutkan bahwa pembeli Efek bukan merupakan Pemodal Profesional.

Pertanyaaan: Siapakah yang bukan termasuk pelaku di pasar modal?

Dari context yang Anda berikan, tidak ada informasi langsung mengenai daftar entitas atau subjek yang bukan termasuk pelaku di pasar modal. Namun, secara umum, pelaku di pasar modal dapat diartikan sebagai pesaing, pemangku kewajiban, atau pemangku aset yang terdaftar dan aktif dalam pasar modal. Mereka dapat berupa emiten, perusahaan efek, reksadana, BUMN, perusahaan publik, serta individu atau lembaga yang secara langsung atau tidak langsung terkait dengan kegiatan pasar modal.

Oleh sebab itu, dengan mengacu pada definisi umum di atas, jawaban untuk pertanyaan nomor 9 adalah:

c. Reksadana

Karena reksadana merupakan suatu entitas yang dapat menjadi pemangku kewajiban atau pemangku aset di pasar modal, mereka bukan termasuk dalam daftar yang diminta. Namun, jika ada informasi lebih lanjut yang tersedia, jawaban ini dapat berubah.

q: 11. Berikut ini merupakan manfaat bursa efek, kecuali
ch:
a. Untuk memperoleh bunga yang tinggi 
b. Untuk memperoleh modal dari luar sector perbankan 
c. Agar masyarakat umum dapat keuntungan perusahaan melalui kepemilikan saham 
d. Untuk melakukan ekspansi perusahaan 
e. Meningkatkan produktivitas perusahaan
answer_mcq:
The capital market in Indonesia is regulated by several regulations, one of which is the Indonesian Capital Market Law No. 8 of 1995. Based on the provided context, I will answer your questions related to the capital market regulation in Indonesia.

Question: Who is responsible for fulfilling the obligations to the securities company for a securities company's customer in a securities transaction?

Answer: According to Pasal 18 of the provided context, a securities company customer is only responsible for fulfilling their obligations to the securities company that carries out the securities transaction on behalf of the customer and is not responsible to other parties, including clearing institutions and guarantors, other securities companies, and other securities company customers.

q: 12. Surat bukti penyertaan modal dinamakan
ch:
a.Emiten
b.Saham
c.Penyertaan
d.Investasi
e.sertifikat
answer_mcq: The term for a document that confirms the participation in capital increases is called "Penyertaan". Therefore, the correct answer is (c) Penyertaan. This term is used in the capital market regulation in Indonesia, specifically in the Additional Letter of the Republic of Indonesia Number 5779 and Number 6145.

q: 13. Salah satu fungsi Bapepam adalah
ch:
a.Melakukan pemeriksaan atas laporan keuangan bagi perusahaan yang akan masuk ke bursa efek 
b.Menjamin emisi efek bagi perusahaan yang ingin menjual saham 
c.Sebagai agen (perantara) perdagangan efek 
d.Mengadakan pembinaan dan pengawasan terhadap bursa efek yang dikelola swasta 
e.Meningkatkan partisipasi mayarakat dalam pengumpulan dana di bursa efek
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the functions of Bapepam (Badan Pengawas Pasar Modal) include:

a. Conducting examinations of financial reports for companies that will enter the stock exchange (Pasal 100 (1) of Undang-undang Nomor 8 Tahun 1995)

d. Conducting supervision and regulation of securities markets managed privately (Pasal 5 litera d of Undang-undang Nomor 8 Tahun 1995)

The options that do not match Bapepam's functions based on the provided context are:

b. Guaranteeing share emissions for companies that want to sell shares (Bapepam's role is to regulate and supervise, not to guarantee)

c. Acting as an agent (intermediary) for securities trading (Bapepam's role is to regulate and supervise, not to trade)

e. Increasing public participation in fundraising at the stock exchange (While Bapepam can promote and facilitate, it is not their primary function to increase public participation)

q: 15. Pasar uang merupakan pertemuan antara permintaan dan penawaran kredit
ch:
a.Jangka pendek 
b.Jangka menengah
c. Jangka Panjang
d.jangka sedang
e.jangka tidak pasti
answer_mcq: Pasar uang merupakan pertemuan antara permintaan dan penawaran kredit dalam jangka pendek. Hal ini disesuaikan dengan Pasal 15 yang menyebutkan bahwa Pasar Uang melibatkan transaksi kredit dalam jangka waktu relatif pendek (Kewenangan Bank Indonesia sebagaimana dimaksud dalam Pasal 27 untuk mengatur kegiatan di Pasar Uang sebagaimana dimaksud dalam Pasal 28 tidak berlaku bagi Pihak yang melakukan penawaran instrumen Pasar Uang yang diterbitkan dan dijamin oleh Pemerintah Indonesia).

q: 16. Salah satu peran pasar modal adalah
ch:
a. Membiayai pembangunan
b. Sebagai indikator perkembangan ekonomi suatu negara
c. Menutupi defisit APBN
d. Salah satu sumber penerimaan pemerintah
e. Harga saham stabil
answer_mcq: Salah satu peran pasar modal adalah membiayai pembangunan, yang diatur dalam Undang-Undang Nomor 8 Tahun 1995 tentang Pasar Modal. Pasar Modal berkaitan dengan kegiatan penawaran umum dan transaksi Efek, pengelolaan investasi, Emiten dan Perusahaan Publik yang berkaitan dengan Efek yang diterbitkannya, serta lembaga dan profesi yang berkaitan dengan Efek. Perusahaan Efek, yang merupakan pihak yang melakukan kegiatan usaha sebagai Penjamin Emisi Efek, Perantara Pedagang Efek, dan/atau Manajer Investasi, dapat dikatakan sebagai "ujung tombak" atau "gugus terdepan" dari industri Pasar Modal.

q: 17. Peranan Bank dalam perdagangan efek adalah sebagai ...
ch:
a. Perantara perdagangan efek
b. Penjual efek secara langsung di bursa
c. Penjamin emisi
d. Pembeli efek
e. Penyandang dana
answer_mcq:
Berdasarkan informasi yang Anda berikan, tidak ada kaitannya dengan peran Bank dalam perdagangan efek. Namun, secara umum, bank dapat memegang peran sebagai kustodian atau penyimpan efek. Artikel 14 dari konteks menjelaskan bahwa Bank Kustodian adalah bank umum yang memperoleh persetujuan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan untuk menyelenggarakan kegiatan usaha sebagai Kustodian. Artikel 16 juga menjelaskan bahwa Lembaga Penyimpanan dan Penyelesaian adalah Pihak yang menyelenggarakan kegiatan Kustodian sentral bagi Bank Kustodian, Perusahaan Efek, dan Pihak lain. Oleh karena itu, jawabannya adalah:

e. Pemegang dana

Kolom ini diminta untuk menulis minimal 30 karakter.

q: 18. Tempat bertemunya permintaan dan penawaran modal untuk jangka waktu yang panjang adalah, kecuali
ch:
a. Pasar modal 
b. Bursa efek
c. Pasar dana 
d. capital market
e. stock exchange
answer_mcq: The correct answer to your question is c. Pasar dana. This is based on the information provided in the 'context' that states the different types of capital markets. Pasar dana, or the money market, is a segment of the capital market where financial instruments with high liquidity and short-term maturities are traded.

q: 19. Berikut yang tidak termasuk perbedaan antara pasar perdana dan pasar sekunder adalah
ch:
a. pada pasar perdana harga tidak berubah, sedangkan pada pasar sekunder harga ditentukan oleh mekanisme pasar
b. transaksi perdagangan di pasar sekunder tidak dikenakan biaya komisi, sedangkanpasar perdana terdapat biaya komisi
c. pada pasar perdana hanya terjadi pembelian saham sedangkan di pasar sekunder dapat terjadi jual beli saham
d. Dari sudut pandang jangka waktu, pasar perdana memiliki batas waktu, sedangkan pasar sekunder tidak
e. Di pasar sekunder semua transaksi harus melalui pialang sedangkan pada pasar perdana tidak demikian
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the differences between the primary market and the secondary market include:

a. On the primary market, the price of securities can change, while on the secondary market, the price is determined by market mechanisms.
b. Transactions in the secondary market are subject to commission fees, while the primary market has no commission fees.
c. In the primary market, there is only purchasing of shares, while in the secondary market, there can be buying and selling of shares.
d. From a time perspective, the primary market has a time limit, whereas the secondary market does not.

The option "e. In the secondary market, all transactions must go through brokers, whereas in the primary market, this is not the case" is not correct. The context does not provide information that supports this statement for either the primary or secondary market.

q: 20. Berikut istilah yang berarti perusahaan menerbitkan saham untuk pertama kali kepada masyarakat, kecuali
ch:
a. go public 
b. IPO
c. investasi modal
d. pasar perdana
e. primary market
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the term that means a company issuing shares to the public for the first time is "IPO" or "Initial Public Offering".

Article 1 number 5 of the regulation mentioned in the context (Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan Nomor 9/POJK.04/2018) defines Penawaran Umum (Public Offering) as an offering of securities conducted by an Issuer to sell securities to the public based on the procedures stipulated in Law No. 8 Year 1995 regarding Capital Market and its implementing regulations.

Therefore, when a company conducts an IPO, it is offering securities to the public for the first time through a public offering, which is regulated by the Indonesian Capital Market regulations.

q: 21. Bentuk perusahaan yang diperbolehkan untuk menerbitkan saham adalah
ch:
a. perusahaan perorangan
b. firma 
c. CV 
d. perseroan terbatas
e. perusahaan daerah
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the questions will be answered as follows:

1. What are the restrictions on share ownership in a company in Indonesia?
According to the Perlindungan Modal dan Kekayaan Perseroan Pasal 37 (1), a company cannot repurchase shares if it causes the company's net assets to be smaller than the total paid-up capital plus the mandatory reserves. Also, based on Pasal 13 (1), a company is prohibited from conducting a capital increase without giving shareholders the right of first refusal for 24 months after the initial public offering of shares.
2. Are there any exceptions to the prohibition of multiple voting rights shares in Indonesia?
Yes, based on Pasal 13 ayat (2), the prohibition does not apply to publicly traded companies that issue multiple voting rights shares as part of a rights issue without giving shareholders the right of first refusal to maintain their voting rights above 50% of the total voting rights.
3. What is the requirement for a company in Indonesia when there are shareholders who are legal entities?
According to the Lampiran Nomor: I-A.6, if a shareholder is a legal entity, the company must disclose the list of controllers or its equivalent when reporting the shareholder composition.
4. What is the restriction on share ownership in a publicly traded company in Indonesia after a stock split or a share consolidation?
Based on Pasal 13 (1), a publicly traded company is prohibited from conducting a capital increase without giving shareholders the right of first refusal for 12 months after a stock split or a share consolidation, except for the purpose of improving the company's financial position or as part of a share ownership program.

My apologies, it seems my database does not have sufficient information to answer the questions about the restrictions on the number of shareholders and the minimum number of shares that must be owned by each shareholder in a company in Indonesia.

answer_mcq:

d. increasing tax revenue

This is stated in Undang-undang (Lembaran Negara Tahun 1952 Nomor 67) and Undang-undang Republik Indonesia Nomor 8 Tahun 1995 tentang Pasar Modal. The capital market serves as a tax revenue source for the government by facilitating the growth of businesses, which in turn increases their tax contributions.

ch:
a. sarana untuk mendapatkan tambahan modal

3. Allowing for the trading of securities (a)
4. Assisting in the management of investments (a)

q: 25. Berikut adalah keuntungan seseorang yang memiliki saham, kecuali
ch:
a. mendapat pembagian keuntungan
b. memiliki sebagian kecil perusahaan
c. gaji meningkat
d. memperoleh capital gain 
e. menerima deviden
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, which appears to be from various articles of the Indonesian Capital Market Law, I can answer your question regarding the rights of a shareholder.

Shareholders have several rights, including:
a. Attending and casting votes in a General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS);
b. Receiving dividends and the remaining assets from liquidation; and
c. Exercising other rights as stipulated in the law.

These rights apply after the shares are recorded in the shareholder register under the shareholder's name. However, certain types of shares may not have the right to vote (huruf a and huruf c) as determined by the relevant law. Each share also gives the shareholder a non-transferable right (huruf d). In the case of multiple owners for one share, they can exercise their rights through a designated representative (huruf e).

The provided context also mentions that a shareholder can increase their share ownership up to 20% of the total issued shares or paid-up capital, as stated in the company's revised budget that has been announced and accepted by the relevant minister (Pasal 27 (1)). Additionally, shareholders with multiple voting rights must maintain ownership of more than 50% of the total voting rights (Pasal 27 (2)).

Please note that the answers provided are based on the context given and the relevant Indonesian Capital Market regulations.

q: 27. Resiko membeli saham suatu perusahaan adalah sebagai berikut, kecuali
ch:
a. Tidak mendapat deviden
b. Mendapat capital gain 
c. Perusahan bangkrutatu dilikuidasi
d. Saham dihpucatatkan dari bursa efek (delisting) 
e. Capital loss
answer_mcq:
The capital market in Indonesia is regulated by several regulations, one of which is the Presiden Republik Indonesia (PRI) No. 32/2004 regarding Capital Market. Based on the context provided, I will answer your questions related to the capital market regulation in Indonesia.

Question: What are the conditions for shareholders to request the company to buy back their shares?

Answer: According to PRI No. 32/2004, shareholders have the right to request the company to buy back their shares if they do not agree with the company's actions that harm the shareholders or the company, such as changes in the company's fundamental structure, transfer or pledge of more than 50% of the company's net assets, or mergers, consolidations, takeovers, or separations. The company must buy back the shares if the number of shares requested exceeds the company's buyback limit as stated in Article 37(1)b. The remaining shares must be sold to third parties.

Question: What is the limit for a company to buy back its own shares?

Answer: Based on PRI No. 32/2004, the total value of the company's treasury shares and pledged shares or collateral for shares owned by the company and/or other companies that directly or indirectly own the company's shares must not exceed 10% of the company's total paid-up capital, except as otherwise provided in the capital market regulations.

Question: What is the risk of buying shares of a company?

Answer: The risks of buying shares of a company include not receiving dividends, making a capital gain, the bankruptcy and liquidation of the company, the delisting of the shares from the stock exchange, and making a capital loss.

q: 28. Di bawah ini yang termasuk contoh effek, kecuali
ch:
a. obligasi
b. surat pengkuan utang
c. kuitansi
d. tanda bukti uang
e. saham
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, which is Peraturan Nomor IX.A.7 concerning the Procedures for the Issuance of Securities in the Capital Market in Indonesia, here are my answers:

1. Apa yang dimaksud dengan "efek yang dijatahkan dalam satu satuan perdagangan"?

Jawab: Secara umum, "efek yang dijatahkan dalam satu satuan perdagangan" (single unit of trading) adalah jumlah minimum efek yang dapat dijual atau dibeli dalam sebuah transaksi. Hal ini dapat dilihat pada Pasal 47 Ayat (1) dari Peraturan Nomor IX.A.7, yang mencakup contoh efek yang tersedia sebanyak 100.000 satuan perdagangan.

2. Apa yang dimaksud dengan "jumlah pemodal yang melakukan pemesanan sebanyak 125.000 Pihak"?

Jawab: Dalam konteks ini, "jumlah pemodal yang melakukan pemesanan sebanyak 125.000 Pihak" (number of investors making a subscription of 125,000 participants) mungkin merujuk pada jumlah total permintaan dari pemodal-pemodal yang ingin membeli efek. Hal ini menunjukkan bahwa jumlah permintaan melebihi jumlah efek yang tersedia, sehingga perlu dilakukan alokasi efek berdasarkan urutan waktu penyampaian pesanan.

3. Apa yang dimaksud dengan "Efek yang dimiliki bersama dalam angka ini adalah Efek yang dimiliki oleh lebih dari satu Pihak dan tercatat atas nama Kustodian"?

Jawab: Secara umum, "Efek yang dimiliki bersama" (co-owned securities) adalah efek yang dimiliki oleh lebih dari satu pihak dan terdaftar atas nama kustodian. Hal ini dapat dilihat pada angka 16 dari dokumen, yang mencakup contoh efek yang dimiliki oleh lebih dari satu pihak dan tercatat atas nama kustodian.

4. Apa yang dimaksud dengan "media massa dalam penjelasan angka ini adalah surat kabar, majalah, film, televisi, radio, dan media elektronik lainnya, serta surat, brosur dan barang cetak lain yang dibagikan kepada lebih dari 100 (seratus) Pihak"?

Jawab: Secara umum, "media massa" (mass media) adalah sarana atau alat yang digunakan untuk mendistribusikan informasi kepada banyak orang. Dalam konteks ini, "media massa" mencakup surat kabar, majalah, film, televisi, radio, dan media elektronik lainnya, serta surat, brosur dan barang cetak lain yang dibagikan kepada lebih dari 100 orang. Hal ini dapat dilihat pada angka 16 dari dokumen.

5. Apa yang termasuk contoh effek dalam "Di bawah ini yang termasuk contoh effek, kecuali..."?

Jawab: Dari pilihan yang diberikan, "obligasi", "surat pengkuan utang", "kuitansi", dan "tanda bukti uang" merupakan contoh dari effek. Namun, "saham" tidak termasuk contoh effek dalam kasus ini. Hal ini dapat dilihat pada soal nomor 28.

q: 29. Indeks yang menunjukkan harga 45 saham yang sangat sering diperdagangkan atau sangat likuid disebut
ch:
a. IHSG 
b.Indeks saham likuid
c.Indeks sektoral
d.Indeks LQ45 
e.IHSG 45
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the question is about the minimum price for taking over listed or unlisted open company shares in Indonesia. I will refer to the relevant regulation, which is Pasal 21 of the Indonesian Capital Market Law.

In the case of taking over unlisted open company shares, the minimum price cannot be lower than the fair market value determined by an independent appraiser (literally, "expert").

Meanwhile, in the case of taking over listed open company shares, the minimum price cannot be lower than the fair market value determined by an independent appraiser or the average closing price of the shares traded on the Indonesia Stock Exchange for the last 12 months, whichever is higher.

Therefore, the answer to the question is that the minimum price for taking over listed open company shares is higher than that for unlisted open company shares.

To summarize:

* For unlisted open company shares: the minimum price cannot be lower than the fair market value determined by an independent appraiser (Pasal 21, huruf b).
* For listed open company shares: the minimum price cannot be lower than the fair market value determined by an independent appraiser or the average closing price of the shares traded on the Indonesia Stock Exchange for the last 12 months, whichever is higher (Pasal 21, huruf c).

I hope this answers your question. Let me know if you have any other questions!

q: 35. Undang-undang yang mengatur pasar modal Indonesia adalah

q: 36. Pasar di mana pertama kali suatu perusahaan menawarkan sahamnya kepada public disebut

answer_mcq:
The context provided discusses the regulations around public companies offering shares in a public offering, including the prerequisites for a company to be considered a public company, the definition of a public offering, and the reporting requirements after a public offering.

Question: What is the name of the regulation and the corresponding article that states the requirement for a public company to report the results of a public offering to the Financial Services Authority?

q: 37. Instrumen (jenis investasi) pasar modal pada umumnya berjangka waktu diatas
ch:
a. satu bulan
b. tiga bulan
c. enam bulan 
d. Sembilan bulan
e. satu tahun
answer_mcq:
Berdasarkan informasi di database saya, Pasal 3 Ayat (1) Peraturan Nomor 9 Tahun 1995 tentang Kebijaksanaan Umum Pasar Modal menetapkan bahwa kegiatan Pasar Modal perlu dipersiapkan, dikelola, dan dipantau agar dapat dilaksanakan secara teratur, wajar, dan efisien. Untuk melakukan pengawasan tersebut, Bapepam diberi kewenangan dan kewajiban untuk membina, mengatur, dan mengawasi setiap pihak yang melakukan kegiatan di Pasar Modal.

Sedangkan untuk soalan nomor 2, Instrumen pasar modal pada umumnya berjangka waktu di atas:
a. satu bulan
b. tiga bulan
c. enam bulan
d. Sembilan bulan
e. satu tahun

Diberdasarkan Pasal 1 ayat (12) Peraturan Nomor 9 Tahun 1995 tentang Kebijaksanaan Umum Pasar Modal, Instrumen adalah surat berhak atau kontrak yang dapat diperjualbelikan dan/atau dicairkan di Pasar Modal dan/atau pasar keuangan yang terorganisir, yang diterbitkan oleh Perusahaan atau lembaga keuangan yang berbadan hukum di Indonesia dan/atau di luar negeri sesuai dengan ketentuan peraturan perundang-undangan. Namun, detail tentang jangka waktu minimal dan maksimal untuk instrumen pasar modal tidak spesifik dijelaskan dalam informasi yang saya miliki. Oleh karena itu, saya tidak dapat menjawab pertanyaan ini dengan pasti. Mohon maaf atas kekeliruan ini.

q: 39. Lembaga atau otoritas tertinggi di pasar modal yang melakukan pengawasan dan pembinaan atas pasar modal adalah:
ch:
a. Bursa Efek 
b. Kustodian
c. Bapepam
d. BAE 
e. Manajer Investasi
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the capital market regulation in Indonesia is mainly regulated by the Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (Financial Services Authority/OJK) based on several regulations. Here are the answers to some questions:

1. Who is responsible for receiving the report from the capital market participants?
According to Pasal 43 of the regulation, the report should be submitted to the OJK. The address for banks is the Department of Bank Supervision related to banks that have their head office or branch in Jakarta or the Regional Office of OJK or Local Office of OJK where the bank's head office is located. For capital market participants, the report should be submitted to the Department of Capital Market Supervision related to the capital market sector. For participants in the Securities and Commodities Market, the report should be submitted to the Department of Securities and Commodities Supervision related to the Securities and Commodities Market sector.
2. What is the authority of OJK in imposing administrative sanctions?
According to Pasal 44 (1) of the regulation, OJK has the authority to impose administrative sanctions on any party that violates the OJK regulations, including those who cause the violation to occur.
3. What is the highest regulatory body or authority in the capital market that conducts supervision and development of the capital market?
Based on the context provided, Lembaga or otoritas tertinggi di pasar modal yang melakukan pengawasan dan pembinaan atas pasar modal adalah Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK).

Regulation references:

1. Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK Regulation)
2. Peraturan Pemerintah (Government Regulation)
3. Undang-Undang (Law)

Please note that the answers provided are based on the context given and the regulations in effect at the time the context was provided. For the most up-to-date information, please refer to the latest regulations from the OJK.

q: 40. Menyebarluaskan informasi-informasi bursa ke masyarakat adalah tugas
ch:
a. Bapepam 
b. KSEI 
c. Emiten 
d. Bursa Efek 
e. Wali Amanat
answer_mcq:
The task of disseminating bourse information to the public is the responsibility of:
d. Bursa Efek (The Stock Exchange)

This is based on the regulation II.6, which states that a listed company must submit periodic and/or incidental reports to the Stock Exchange no later than when such information is made public. Additionally, according to regulation II.7.1, the Stock Exchange can request clarification or information from a listed company and related parties, both orally and in writing through electronic media or other means determined by the Stock Exchange. This demonstrates the active role of the Stock Exchange in ensuring the dissemination of accurate and timely information from listed companies to the public.

q: 41. Bank yang bertindak sebagai tempat penyimpanan dan penitipan uang, surat-surat berharga, maupun barang-barang berharga lainnya adalah
ch:
a. Bank Indonesia 
b. Bank Kustodian 
c. Wali Amanat 
d. Bursa Efek 
e. Manajer Investasi
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the information related to the options in question 41 can be found in Pasal 14 of the regulation, which states that a Kustodian is an institution that provides safekeeping services for securities and other related assets, including receiving dividends, interest, and other rights, settling security transactions, and representing the account holders who are their clients.

Based on this information, the correct answer to question 41 is option b, which is Bank Kustodian.

q: 44. Sejak tahun 1995, BEJ telah menggunakan sistem perdagangan otomatis yang di kenal dengan istilah
ch:
a. remote trading 
b. Scripless trading 
c. Jakarta automated trading system (JATS)
d. Automatic trading 
e. Halting system
answer_mcq:
The capital market regulation in Indonesia that is relevant to your questions is the Indonesian Capital Market Law No. 8 of 1995 and its implementing regulations.

Based on the context provided, the correct answer to the question is:

c. Jakarta automated trading system (JATS)

The Jakarta Automated Trading System (JATS) is a system of automated trading that has been used by the Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEJ) since 1995. JATS is a computerized system that automates the trading process, making it faster and more efficient. This system is in line with the principle of an efficient capital market, which is based on clear and consistent rules, and where market prices reflect the balance between supply and demand.

q: 45. Istilah yang menunjukan satuan perdagangan saham adalah
ch:
a.Fraksi harga
b.Unit penyertaan
c.Unit
d.Lot 
e.Nominal
answer_mcq:
Based on the provided context, the regulation related to capital market regulation in Indonesia is the "Lembaran Negara Republik Indonesia Nomor 10/OJK."

In the context provided, the following are the explanations related to the questions:

1. The term for the unit of share trading is "lot."

Istilah yang menunjukan satuan perdagangan saham adalah "lot." (e)

1. The minimum price for buying back shares is determined by the higher value between the average trading price in the last 30 days or the book value per share based on the latest financial report.

Harga pembelian kembali saham disesuaikan dengan nilai yang lebih tinggi antara harga rata-rata perdagangan saham Perusahaan Terbuka dalam jangka waktu 30 (tiga puluh) hari terakhir yang dihitung mundur dari hari perdagangan terakhir atau nilai buku per saham berdasarkan laporan keuangan terakhir. Pasal 7, Pasal 79, dan Pasal 19.

1. The selling price of shares in a share buyback program must follow the higher value between the closing price of the previous day's trading or the average closing price in the last 90 days.

Harga penjualan saham wajib mengikuti ketentuan: a. atas saham Perusahaan Terbuka yang tercatat dan diperdagangkan di Bursa Efek, tidak boleh lebih rendah dari harga penutupan perdagangan harian di Bursa Efek 1 (satu) hari sebelum tanggal penjualan saham atau harga rata-rata dari harga penutupan perdagangan harian di Bursa Efek selama 90 (sembilan puluh) hari terakhir sebelum tanggal penjualan saham oleh Perusahaan Terbuka, mana yang lebih tinggi. Pasal 20.

1. The buyback price of shares in a delisted or suspended company must be higher than the average of the highest daily closing price in the last 12 months or the fair value determined by a registered appraiser.

Harga pembelian saham harus lebih tinggi dari harga rata-rata dari harga tertinggi perdagangan harian di Bursa Efek dalam waktu 12 (dua belas) bulan terakhir yang dihitung mundur dari hari perdagangan terakhir atau harga wajar yang ditetapkan oleh penilai yang terdaftar di Otoritas Jasa Keuangan. Pasal 77.

1. The conversion obligation price will be automatically adjusted with the Share Consolidation. Namun demikian, harga pelaksanaan minimal sebesar Rp1.000,00 (seribu rupiah) disesuaikan menjadi Rp5.000,00 (lima ribu rupiah) per saham apabila harga saham berada di bawah Rp5.000,00 (lima ribu rupiah) mengingat parameter ini terpengaruh dengan Penggabungan Saham. Pasal 37.

Please note that the explanations are based on the provided context and the Lembaran Negara Republik Indonesia Nomor 10/OJK.

q: 50. Seorang investor membeli saham pada harga Rp.3400,-/saham.kerugian investor tersebut dikenal dengan istilah.
ch:
a. Capital gain 
b. Capital loss 
c. Depresiasi
d. Dilusi
e. Negative return
answer_mcq:
The correct answer is (b) Capital loss.

The investor is experiencing a decrease in the value of their investment, as they bought the shares at a higher price (Rp.3400,-/share) than the current market price. This situation is referred to as a capital loss.

q: 51. Sesi pertama perdangan saham di BEJ dimulai pukul
ch:
a. 09.00 wib
b. 09.30 wib
c. 10.00 wib
d. 09.15 wib
e. 09.45 wib
answer_mcq:
The information provided in the 'context' refers to several regulations regarding capital market practices in Indonesia. However, you did not ask a specific question. Therefore, I will provide a general explanation based on the 'context'.

The 'context' includes several regulations related to share buybacks, conversion obligations, and the prohibition of certain actions without prior approval.

Share buybacks (Pembelian Saham) are regulated in the 'context' by several provisions, including the obligation to implement the buyback within one working day after the effective date of the share buyback and no later than five business days on the exchange (Article 7(1) and (3)). The purchase price must follow the rules regarding the purchase price of less than one trading unit of shares (Article 7(1) and Article 16(1)). If the shares acquired do not meet the trading unit requirement, the company can issue new shares for the buyer to meet the trading unit requirement (Article 16(2) and (3)).

Conversion obligations (Obligasi Konversi) are also mentioned in the 'context'. The conversion price is automatically adjusted according to the average price over 20 business days, with a minimum price of IDR 1,000 (Article 37).

The 'context' also includes provisions regarding the prohibition of certain actions, such as share splitting, share consolidation, and capital increases without the right to subscribe to new shares (Article 12(1)).

Regarding your question about the opening time of the Jakarta Stock Exchange, it is not mentioned in the provided 'context'. However, according to the official website of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, the first trading session starts at 09.00 WIB (Indonesian Western Time).

q: 52. Sesi kedua perdangan saham di BEJ ditutup pada pukul
ch:
a. 15.00 wib
b. 15.30 wib
c. 17.00 wib
d. 16.00 wib
e. 16.30 wib
answer_mcq:
Dalam Peraturan Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK) yang berlaku, tidak ada informasi langsung yang menyebutkan mengenai jam penutupan sesi kedua perdagangan saham di Bursa Efek Jakarta (BEJ). Namun, secara umum, sesi perdagangan saham di BEJ terdiri dari dua sesi, yaitu sesi pagi dan sesi siang. Sesi pagi dimulai pukul 09.00 WIB dan diakhiri pukul 11.30 WIB, sedangkan sesi siang dimulai pukul 13.00 WIB dan diakhiri pukul 15.00 WIB.

Jadi, dari informasi di atas, jawaban yang tepat adalah:
d. 16.00 wib
